text:
When reading XML files in a Listener, JMeter currently loads the whole file before passing the samples on. This uses a lot of memory.

Loading XML files should be changed to process samples as they are read from the XML file.

Perhaps also needs to be considered for loading test plans.
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Turns out it was partly due to creating the TestResultWrapper with all the samples, and partly because XStream was caching samples in case of a subsequent reference to them.

Fixed in SVN as of r712398:

URL: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?rev=712398&view=rev
Log:
More efficient loading of JTL files
Don't clear Visualizer before loading the file
